intro: Vernonia vaniotii, commonly known as the Vaniot's ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow to brown flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid regions of its native range. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
